title: Three Views
content:
Three Views
[三观]
Let’s pause the review of thinking models and insert something from The Adult’s Guide to Growth—today’s topic is the “Three Views.”
[今天先不继续做思维模式的复述，来插入《成年人修炼指南》的内容——今天的话题是“三观”。]
The “Three Views” commonly refer to one’s worldview, outlook on life, and values.
[我们通常说的三观包括世界观、人生观和价值观。]
Worldview is how you understand and perceive the world—how do you think the world works?
[世界观是你如何理解和认知这个世界——你认为世界是如何运作的？]
Some believe in fate, others trust evolution and scientific evidence, and some choose religion.
[有些人相信宿命，有些人相信进化论和科学实证，还有些人选择宗教。]
Your outlook on life answers: How should I live? What are my life goals? What am I striving for?
[人生观是回答：我该怎么活？我的人生目标是什么？我追求什么？]
Your values help you decide what matters most when making choices.
[价值观则是在各种选择中判断什么更重要。]
There are many kinds of values, but what truly matters is the order you assign to them.
[价值观有很多条，关键在于你如何排序。]
Here’s a simple analogy:
[我们来打个比方：]
If you were a computer—
[如果把你比作一台电脑——]
Your worldview is your operating system (Mac, Windows, or Linux);
[你的世界观就是你装的底层操作系统（Mac、Windows 或 Linux）；]
Your outlook on life is your set goal or user path (to be a programmer, a seeker, or a free spirit);
[你的人生观是你设定的目标路径（成为程序员、修行者或自由者）；]
And your values are the plugins and shortcuts you install (what you prioritize, avoid, or how you act).
[你的价值观就是你在使用过程中装的插件和快捷方式（优先做什么、不做什么、怎么做）。]
One final reminder from ChatGPT:
[最后一点来自 ChatGPT 的提醒：]
Many people claim to have “righteous values,” but they’re often just repeating mainstream ideas without ever reflecting on what they truly believe, how they want to live, and what they care about most.
[很多人嘴上说自己“三观正”，其实只是记住了社会主流价值观，却从没系统地思考过自己真正相信什么、想活成什么样、最在乎什么。]
So the key isn’t whether your views are “correct,” but whether you’re continuously exploring and practicing the set of views that truly fit you.
[所以三观是否“正”不是最重要的，不断探索、实践出适合自己的三观，才是最重要的。]
